data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 10 steps forward. Thus, a person would never take 10 steps backward. In these instructions, we only see an example of an order. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Do you follow the 4 steps to turn around. Do you turn around? Yes. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You take 6 steps and 5 minutes to return to your starting point. You take 4 steps and 6 minutes to return to your starting point. Each of these steps requires you to return to another location. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Once you turn left, you’ll be back at the start. So, the answer is No.

If you walk right on the 2nd step for example, the first step is 10 steps. And you take 3 steps, turn around for instance. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning left and right is the same as returning to the starting point. Turning around and turning right is also the same as returning to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The same sequences converge back at the starting point. Turning right repeats this sequence a third time. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The first 3 steps lead nowhere. The last step returns to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To walk a straight line forward, you should always face forward. To walk in a diagonal way, you should always turn back. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you take the time to move back to the starting point, you repeat the entire process of taking the time to move back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step backward does not correspond to always facing forward. Thus, the answer is No.

If you always face forward, you can take 6 steps backward. The only step backward is the one in 1st step. If you always face forward and you take 8 steps right then you take 8 steps right. If you always take 4 steps right then you take 4 steps right. If you always take 5 steps left then you take 5 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 4 steps right. The first rule is to always face forward. So, the answer is No.

Before we see a circle pointing outwards, we are always facing forward. The answer: yes.

First, all steps should always be facing forward. The third method has 3 steps right to start with, the fourth one a step back. So, the answer is no.

Turn around and turn around turn left. Take 8 steps take 2 steps take 3 steps take 4 steps Take 4 steps take 4 steps take 6 steps take 4 steps so you return to where you started 5 steps take 2. So, the answer is No.

If you follow the instruction from step 5, you will return to the start point. If you follow the instructions from step 7 and take 2 of 4 steps, you will return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is in the middle of the circle. The shortest path back to the starting point is around the circle. It would take 9 steps to get you back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you turn right at the beginning of the sentence you take 1 step. If you turn right at the end of the sentence you take 7 steps. All of these are actions which can take many steps. So, the answer is Yes.

You take 1 step to take one step. If you take 3 steps, you take 6 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow this method, you can return to any location in the same order as you came. If you take 6 steps to get back to the starting point, you are back at your original location. So, the answer is yes.

First you should see the start of the pattern.

The directions return you to the starting point if you turn outside. The starting point is a straight line. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, you can't take 3 steps backward if you continue on your path forward. The number of steps you take backward and forward is a way of identifying where you are. So, the answer is No.

If you walked 9 steps, you would only need to be back at the beginning point once. So, the answer is yes.

Take 10 steps right. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Let’ s say you start from ea. E A way. E B A way. E C A D E B A. It took 7 steps to turn around. Take 5 steps to turn around. Take 1 step to take 6 steps. No. And so on. So, the answer is No.

As you walk in steps, always face forward. When walking backward, you take 2 steps back, which is the same direction that you came. If you are facing forward, it is the same direction you came. In this manner, you would also always continue forward. So, the answer is No.

Backward is the direction that you took a step. A step backward is another direction. Taking 6 steps left ends your journey back to the starting one. If your exit is the beginning your journey starts again and you start where you left off. So, the answer is Yes.

One must be facing forward in order to take any steps. One must never take anywhere in the direction in which they are facing, except straight out with the opposite direction of their path, which is forward. The following is a complete set of steps; you cannot go back to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

If you take 4 steps backward, you are taking 2 steps left. If you take 8 steps backward, you are taking 8 steps backward. The answer: No.

When you face forward always face forward and you always take 4 steps backward. This takes you back to the first step. When you facing forward 6 steps forwards. If you follow these instructions, you can safely take 6 steps forwards. So, the answer is Yes.

If you start from square one (square 1), follow the direction you came from there. If you don’t turn around, you haven’t returned to square one. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The instructions are given in a sentence, but they are not in a sentence. The sentence is a verbatim version of a written instruction. The sentence is a verbatim version of a story. The first part of the sentence starts with the verbatim version of that sentence repeated from a forward perspective and has all its parts repeated from a backward perspective with a forward ending. The sentence and the narrative are the same. So, the answer is yes.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Each step does not go further forward than any previous step. If you take 3 steps to the right, you take 3 steps to the left. The first 2 steps go straight forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Face forward is always a good thing in mathematics. If you follow these instructions, it will be difficult to step back when you see that there are 3 steps left. If you do not face forward, you will walk in circles for the remainder of the game, ending up in the same place in every round. So, the answer is No.
